result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody A Johnson

records.addlTxt: Letters of Support from T.R. & L.P.- sent to JA
Pre-trial conference on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:43 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

Date and time set for JSH; VRCW. 
Defendant makes statement; was trying to reach DA office.  
ADA Zibolski makes statement; leave trial date on or move trial date at defendant's request. 
Defendant makes arguments re: letters of recommendation trying to provide to DA office. 
COURT addresses defendant re: getting letters; Defendant understands. 

COURT removes JT for deft to accumulate letters of deft character.  

COURT sets PTC 11/10/22 at 8:30 a.m. 

Adj:   9:50 a.m.
Letter from deft to ADA re: apology.

Jury status hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Jury Trial on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Jury Trial on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  1:42 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

Date and time set for FPT. 
COURT recites off record discussions; deft would like time to discuss settlement with DA office. 
Clerk provides Waiver of Right to Attorney form to fill out today and file with Clerk of Court; defendant understands. 

COURT sets PTC 9/07/22 at 1:00 p.m. 

COURT continues already set dates on case. 

Adj:  1:44 p.m.
Ltr from Defendant re charges.
Amended: NO VIOLENT or ABUSIVE contact with Co-Defendant; A.M.P; Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:01 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

Date and time set for hearing re: motion to lift no contact; VRCW. 
COURT recites motion request and questions defendant.   
Defendant makes statement. 
COURT questions victim who appears in person; also requests no contact be lifted. 
State objects to removal of no contact completely but would suggest no violent contact. 

COURT makes findings and amends bond to NO VIOLENT or ABUSIVE contact with A.M.P.; all other conditions remain the same.

Adj:  10:08 a.m.
Hearing on June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from C.A.J. re no contact order- stj
from A.M.P. re no contact order- stj

Pre-trial conference on June 21, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Jury Trial on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Jury status hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Jury Trial on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with Co-Defendant; A.M.P; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.

Clerk: Amy. 
Case called:  2:48 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher for ADA Natalie Zibolski.   Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived. Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  Not guilty by Court.  

COURT ORDERS: $250.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with co-deft; A.M.P. 
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.
